channel.title: GeForce Driver Issues
channel.description:
So the other day I updated my drivers, hoping to get at least slightly better performance since apparently I was using the 2010 driver. My games now have slightly worse performance than they did before.
Some specific examples: Half-Life 2 - Every time the suppression device fires, I get unplayable amounts of lag/stutter until all those particles are gone. This used to be perfectly fine. Resident Evil 3: Nemesis - There are lines all across the screen. Normally disabling texture correction would fix this, it doesn't anymore. Halo - All saves mysteriously erased, may or may not be the driver's fault. Just Cause 2 - The whole screen is forced into a box on launch.
Is there a solution of some kind, or will I just have to see if the next update is any better? By the way, I'm using a GeForce 9100M G.

item.title: GeForce Driver Issues
item.dc:creator: MSKyuuni
item.description:
sersoft:

the new drivers could have changed the 3d rendering settings to more gpu-intensive ones, try setting textures and other stuff to “performance” and make sure vsync is off.

Thanks, it’s fine now!
